message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CR

This paper is likely to belong to the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning) as it proposes a modification to deep Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) to improve their robustness. It also uses popular training strategies to train the modified CNNs. 

It is also likely to belong to the sub-category of cs.CV (Computer Vision) as the experiments are conducted on image datasets (MNIST and CIFAR-10) and the modified CNNs are tested for their ability to classify clean and adversarial samples. 

The paper may also belong to the sub-category of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) as it proposes a solution to a common problem in deep learning, i.e., the vulnerability of CNNs to adversarial samples. 

The sub-category of cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) is also likely as the paper proposes the use of Symmetric Activation Functions (SAFs) in non-linear signal transducer units to suppress unusual signals within network layers. 

Finally, the sub-category of cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) is also possible as the paper addresses the issue of adversarial attacks on deep learning models, which is a security concern.
